wikipedia_page.main:
Frederick George Foulds (born 23 April 1935) is a former English cricketer. Foulds was a right-handed batsman.  He was born at Leicester, Leicestershire.
Foulds made two first-class appearances for Leicestershire against Cambridge University at Fenner's in 1952, and Sussex at Grace Road in the 1956 County Championship.  In four batting innings, he scored just a single run, was dismissed for a duck three times and finished with a batting average of 0.25.
